Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.controller.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServerRemote, java.rmi.Remote
    public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
implements ServerRemote
    This class contains all the necessary methods to communicate with the clients. It represents the server-side access to the network

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      This method is the constructor of the class.

      This method is the constructor of the class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server​(java.lang.String serverIp,
              int loginTimer,
              int inactivityTime)
       throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is the constructor of the class. It sets up RMI and Socket connection, and also runs a ping thread that checks if clients disconnect It accepts parameters that overwrite the default ones
        Parameters:
        serverIp - is the ip of the server
        loginTimer - is the login timer in the lobby
        inactivityTime - is the inactivity time of the user
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if any step of the setup goes wrong

      • Server

        public Server()
       throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is the constructor of the class. It sets up RMI and Socket connection, and also runs a ping thread that checks if clients disconnect
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if any step of the setup goes wrong

    • Method Detail

      • setSmartModel

        public void setSmartModel​(SmartModel smartModel)
        This method sets the correct reference to the smart model sent to the client when an update on the model is performed
        Parameters:
        smartModel - is the smartModel to be sent to the players

      • startLoginPhase

        public void startLoginPhase()
        This method resets the client map attribute and allows new registrations until the login is closed

      • stopLoginPhase

        public void stopLoginPhase()
        This method checks if there are enough clients connected to start the game. If so, it sets loginPhase attribute to false, and saves the nickname list when the login closes

      • isLoginPhase

        public java.lang.Boolean isLoginPhase()
        Returns:
        true if the login phase is opened (which means that new clients are allowed to register in client map) false if the login phase is closed

      • getNicknameSet

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getNicknameSet()
        Returns:
        a list containing the nicknames registered when the login closed

      • getActivePlayers

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getActivePlayers()
        Returns:
        a set containing the nicknames of the currently connected players

      • isConnected

        public java.lang.Boolean isConnected​(Player player)
        Parameters:
        player - is the player which connection is checked
        Returns:
        true if the user associated to players is connected false if the user associated to player is not connected

      • resetClientMap

        public void resetClientMap()
        This methods forces the reset of the client map. It removes all the players connected

      • forceLogout

        public void forceLogout​(Player player)
        This method forces the logout of a player, directly removing it from the client map
        Parameters:
        player - is the player to be removed

      • ping

        public int ping​(ClientRemote c)
         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: ServerRemote
        This method should just return any value. It is used to check the connection
        Specified by:
        ping in interface ServerRemote
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • login

        public int login​(java.lang.String s,
                 ClientRemote c)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: ServerRemote
        This method should allow the client to register his remote interface on the server using an id Registering the remote interface on the server, allow him to call back the client with the given remote methods
        Specified by:
        login in interface ServerRemote
        Parameters:
        s - should be the id used for the registration
        c - should be the remote interface of the client to be registered
        Returns:
        an int value that represents the outcome of the login
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • logout

        public void logout​(ClientRemote c)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: ServerRemote
        This method allows the client to unregister his remote interface from the server
        Specified by:
        logout in interface ServerRemote
        Parameters:
        c - should be the remote interface of the client to be unregistered
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getModelUpdate

        public java.lang.String getModelUpdate()
                                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: ServerRemote
        This method should allow the client to request an update of the model
        Specified by:
        getModelUpdate in interface ServerRemote
        Returns:
        a pocket serialized version of the model
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage​(Player player,
                        java.lang.String message)
                 throws UnavailableUserException
        This method sends a message to a specific player. It should be used to send messages inherent in the game (I.E. "It is your turn")
        Parameters:
        player - is the player to send the message to
        message - is the message to be sent
        Throws:
        UnavailableUserException - if the player is not connected or the network timeout expires

      • notifyEvent

        public void notifyEvent​(java.lang.String s)
        This method notifies all the players about an event. It should be used to notify about events not inherent in the game (I.E. "Player disconnected")
        Parameters:
        s - is the event to be notified

      • choosePlayer

        public Player choosePlayer​(Player player,
                           java.util.ArrayList<Player> arrayList)
                    throws UnavailableUserException
        This method asks a player to make a single choice in a set of players
        Parameters:
        player - is the player who makes the choice
        arrayList - is the set of players to choose from
        Returns:
        the player chosen by the player
        Throws:
        UnavailableUserException - if the player is not connected or the network timeout expires

        player - is the player who makes the choice
        Returns:
        a character representing the chosen direction N - North S - South W - West E - East

      • chooseMap

        public int chooseMap​(Player player,
                     int min,
                     int max)
              throws UnavailableUserException
        This method asks a player to choose a map. More specifically, it asks to choose in a range of indexes, which meaning is defined by the users of this class
        Parameters:
        player - is the player who makes the choice
        min - is the minimum index to choose
        max - is the maximum index to choose
        Returns:
        an int value that represents the chosen map
        Throws:
        UnavailableUserException - if the player is not connected or the network timeout expires

      • chooseMode

        public java.lang.Character chooseMode​(Player player)
                               throws UnavailableUserException
        This method asks a player to choose a game mode between normal and domination
        Parameters:
        player - is the player who makes the choice
        Returns:
        a character representing the chosen game mode N - Normal D - Domination
        Throws:
        UnavailableUserException - if the player is not connected or the network timeout expires
